## ğŸš€ Conventional Commit Types

| Type         | SemVer ImpactÂ¹ | When to Use                                                | Example                                  |
| ------------ | -------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- |
| **feat**     | **minor**      | Introducing a new, userâ€‘visible feature.                   | `feat(ui): add darkâ€‘mode toggle`         |
| **fix**      | patch          | Bug fix or regression repair.                              | `fix(api): handle 404 on missing post`   |
| **perf**     | patch          | Performance improvement **w/out** functional change.       | `perf(build): cache Astro images`        |
| **docs**     | â€”              | Documentation only (README, JSDoc, comments).              | `docs(readme): clarify setup steps`      |
| **style**    | â€”              | Formatting, whiteâ€‘space, eslint/prettier changes.          | `style(posts): run biome format`         |
| **refactor** | â€” (or patchÂ²)  | Code restructure **without** behaviour change.             | `refactor(utils): extract slug helper`   |
| **test**     | â€”              | Adding or updating tests.                                  | `test(blog): add pagination unit tests`  |
| **ci**       | â€”              | Changes to CI/CD pipelines or workflows.                   | `ci(github): add titleâ€‘lint action`      |
| **build**    | â€”              | Build system or external dependency changes.               | `build(cf-pages): bump wrangler to v4`   |
| **chore**    | â€”              | Routine maintenance (deps, tidyÂ files).                    | `chore(deps): upgrade astro to 5.4.2`    |
| **revert**   | â¬† depends      | Reverts a previous commit. Autoâ€‘generated by `git revert`. | `revert: feat(ui): add darkâ€‘mode toggle` |
| **post**     | â€”              | **Contentâ€‘only** blog/MDX commits (ignored by SemVer).     | `post(blog): publish author spotlight`   |

> Â¹Â Default behaviour of **semanticâ€‘release**. Only `feat`, `fix`, `perf`, or any commit that
> contains a `BREAKING CHANGE:` footer cause a version bump.
>
> Â²Â If you want refactors to trigger a patch bump, add a `releaseRules` entry in `.releaserc`.

## ğŸ“‘ Custom `#hashâ€‘tags` Quick Reference

### Post & Section Automation

| Hashâ€‘Tag               | Purpose                                       | Example                         | Effect                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
| `#add-post:slug`       | Add a **new** blog post file.                 | `#add-post:launch-recap`        | Generates `/blog/launch-recap.mdx` |
| `#delete-post:slug`    | Remove an existing post.                      | `#delete-post:old-announcement` | Deletes file & purges cache        |
| `#update-section:slug` | Force rebuild/cacheâ€‘purge of a nonâ€‘post page. | `#update-section:about`         | Purges `/about` from CDN           |

### Experimental / Advanced

| Hashâ€‘Tag                   | Purpose                                       | Example                        |
| -------------------------- | --------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------ |
| `#draft-post:slug`         | Scaffold a post **draft** with `draft: true`. | `#draft-post:ai-preview`       |
| `#sync:airtable:slug`      | Pull structured data from Airtable.           | `#sync:airtable:speakers-2025` |
| `#refresh-feed:collection` | Regenerate RSS for one collection.            | `#refresh-feed:community`      |

## ğŸ§  Usage Tips

* Place **hashâ€‘tags at the *end*** of the commit subject or changelog line.
* They are **caseâ€‘sensitive**.
* Use kebabâ€‘case ( `slug-example` ) or snake_case â€” *no spaces*.
* Combine freely with conventional scopes:

```bash
# Example multiâ€‘tag conventional commit
post(blog): publish accessibility article #add-post:accessible-ui date="2025-04-17"

# Feature touching code + selectiveâ€‘deploy tag
feat(ui): add filter component #update-section:projects
```

## â„¹ï¸ Why ignore docs/style/refactor/etc. for versioning?

Keeping nonâ€‘userâ€‘visible changes from bumping SemVer reduces noise for consumers
and keeps release notes focused on what matters to endâ€‘users.
If you need a release anyway (e.g., refactor includes API changes), add either:

* A `BREAKING CHANGE:` footer â€” triggers **major**.
* `!` after the type: `refactor!: migrate to new hook` â€” triggers **major**.
* Custom `releaseRules` in `.releaserc`.
